str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Neuter Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A myriad, group of ten thousand, a ten thousand. From murioi; a ten-thousand; by extension, a 'myriad' or indefinite number.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Feminine Plural
str2: To collect, gather together, assemble. From epi and sunago; to collect upon the same place.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.
From kata and pateo; to trample down; figuratively, to reject with disdain.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
(a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pros and echo; to hold the mind towards, i.e. Pay attention to, be cautious about, apply oneself to, adhere to.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Leaven, ferment, both lit. and met. Probably from zeo; ferment.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Whosoever, whichsoever, whatsoever.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From hupokrinomai; acting under a feigned part, i.e. deceit.
